required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on July 28, 2020
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: Age-related Correlates of Treatment for Late-acquired Sounds
clinical_study.official_title: Age-related Correlates of Treatment Efficacy and Efficiency for Late-acquired Sounds

brief_summary.textblock: Late-acquired sounds, such as /r/ are difficult to learn and many children experience persistent errors on these sounds. The purpose of the present study is to determine whether treating these sounds earlier in the child's life may result in better outcomes.

detailed_description.textblock: Late-acquired sounds, such as /r/ are difficult to learn and many children experience persistent errors on these sounds. However, these sounds are often treated later in a child's life because they are not expected to be fully acquired until quite late--age 7-8 for some sounds. This practice places treatment in a time of the child's development in which they struggle to learn new sounds.The purpose of the present study is to determine whether treating these sounds earlier in the child's life may result in better outcomes, and to examine treatment efficacy and efficiency for two methods of treatment.

study_design_info.intervention_model_description: Young children (age 4-5) and Old children (age 7-8) will be enrolled in either a Motoric behavioral treatment arm or phonological treatment arm.

primary_outcome.measure: Treatment Efficacy: Number of correct productions of treated speech sounds in treatment words
primary_outcome.time_frame: baseline until accuracy criterion is met; up to 18 weeks after final baseline session
primary_outcome.description: Accurate Production of treatment sound at baseline and at posttest

primary_outcome.measure: Treatment Efficiency: Number of sessions required to meet accuracy criteria
primary_outcome.time_frame: baseline until accuracy criterion is met; up to 18 weeks after final baseline session
primary_outcome.description: Number of treatment sessions required to meet accuracy criteria (90% accuracy across three consecutive sessions or a maximum of 35 treatment sessions)

primary_outcome.measure: Session Length: Mean duration of sessions in minutes
primary_outcome.time_frame: First treatment session until final treatment session. Final treatment session occurs when accuracy of treatment sound is met (90% accuracy across three consecutive sessions or a maximum of 35 treatment sessions)
primary_outcome.description: Start and end time of session is recorded on scoresheet, then number of minutes for each session for each participant is found and the mean across all sessions is calculated.

secondary_outcome.measure: Accuracy of production of untreated sounds measured on pretest and posttest probes
secondary_outcome.time_frame: baseline and at posttest up to 18 weeks after final baseline session
secondary_outcome.description: Some children may generalize their skills learned through treatment to sounds that were not treated in the trial.

arm_group.description: Children will participate in an intervention based on traditional articulation approaches to speech therapy.
Children will receive intervention that targets the conceptual representation of sounds.

intervention.description: children receive instruction in producing new sounds at the isolation, syllable and word level.
children receive instruction in producing new sounds at the word level

criteria.textblock:
Inclusionary Criteria:
- Normal Hearing
- Typical Receptive Language
- Speech Sound Disorder
- No motor speech impairment
- Typical non-verbal intelligence
- Produces at least one late-acquired sound with <7% accuracy
- Monolingual English-speaking
- Typical in terms of motoric and neurological development
Exclusionary Criteria:
- Neurological disorder
- Hearing loss
- Nonverbal IQ < 16th percentile
